Johnson, James Warner Bellah, Willis Goldbeck', 'Number of discs': '1'} Great movie, fun characters, great message (Right wins out with courage).

Lee Marvin almost stole the movie!

If you love the Duke - add it to your collection.

(Personally, I don't care if the Duke read the Hollywood phone book out loud - it would still be a GREAT movie.) Don't over-think it {'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Todd Graff'], 'Producers': ['Michael Nathanson', 'Joseph Farrell', 'Catherine Paura', 'Broderick Johnson', 'Andrew A. Kosove', 'Timothy M. Bourne', 'Queen Latifah', 'Shakim Compere'], 'Starring': ['Queen Latifah', 'Dolly Parton', 'Keke Palmer'], 'Studio': ['WARNER BROS.']} The movie had a great premise. I thought it would be on the lines of "Sister Act". A clean comedy with joyful music. It was until someone had to interject profanity into the movie for some strange reason. THEN we had choir members sleeping with each other - yeah - that was funny and so very Christian like. It was so sad to see beautiful voices wasted. And Dolly - what were you thinking??

So - turned it off (after we paid to rent it) and read a book..... Could have been great = Slams Christian values Seven Days in Utopia Robert Duvall (Actor), Lucas Black (Actor), Matt Russell (Director) & 0 more Rated: G Format: DVD Movies & TV, Independently Distributed, Drama ["SEVEN DAYS IN UTOPIA follows the story of Luke Chisolm (Lucas Black), a talented young golfer set on making the pro tour. When his first big shot turns out to be a very public disaster, Luke escapes the pressures of the game and finds himself unexpectedly stranded in Utopia, Texas, home to eccentric rancher Johnny Crawford (Robert Duvall). But Johnny's more than meets the eye, and his profound ways of looking at life force Luke to question not only his past choices, but his direction for the future."] {'Genre': 'Drama, Sports', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Dolby, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Lucas Black, Matt Russell, Robert Duvall, Deborah Ann Woll, Jerry Ferrara, Madison Burge, Melissa Leo, KJ ChoiLucas Black, Matt Russell, Robert Duvall, Deborah Ann Woll, Jerry Ferrara, Madison Burge, Melissa Leo, KJ Choi See more', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 40 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'G (General Audience)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.5 x 5.5 x 7.7 inches; 3.2 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'ARCE82451DVD', 'Director': 'Matt Russell', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Dolby, NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 40 minutes', 'Release date': 'November 29, 2011', 'Actors': 'Robert Duvall, Lucas Black, Melissa Leo, Deborah Ann Woll, Madison Burge', 'Studio': 'Arc Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '1'} Absolutely stunning in its simplicity and truth. A MUST SEE for Fathers, coaches, professionals in all walks of life. Give this as a gift to someone you love! Awesome We're No Angels (1955) Comedy, Romance, Cheerful, Gentle ["In Christmas, three prisoners - Joseph, Albert and Jules - escape from the Devil's Island to a small coastal town in France. They decide to rob a store to get some money and clothes and travel by ship to another place"] {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Michael Curtiz'], 'Producers': ['Pat Duggan'], 'Starring': ['Humphrey Bogart', 'Aldo Ray', 'Peter Ustinov']} One of the best Christmas movies to ever come out of Hollywood! The cast is superb, the humor and wit is intensely understated. This is a timeless movie! YAY! VeggieTales: The Wonderful Wizard of Ha's (DVD) Brian Roberts (Director), Mike Nawrocki (Actor), Phil Vischer (Actor, Writer) & 0 more Rated: NR Format: DVD Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Kids & Family ["VeggieTales: The Wonderful Wizard of Ha's (DVD)", "Meet Darby [Junior Asparagus] who more than anything else in the world just wants to have fun. When he learns about the Wonderful Land of Ha's - an amusement park with all the fixins - and its mysterious wizard who promises to make his dreams come true, Darby is determined to go. Darby decides that nothing is going to stop him and he makes a choice that will change his life forever. Will it be worth everything Darby has given up? Find out in this story of the prodigal son - an over-the-rainbow adventure that reminds kids everywhere that there's no place like home.", ']]>'] {'Genre': 'Kids & Family, Animation, Educational', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Animated, Closed-captioned, Color, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Phil Vischer, Brian Roberts, J. profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Interests:** The user has a robust passion for classic Western films and family-friendly content that promotes traditional values. Their recent acquisition highlights an ongoing commitment to engaging, moral stories suitable for young audiences, especially those that reflect Christian principles.

- **Viewing Preferences:** The user continues to gravitate towards films that emphasize strong narratives with moral themes like courage and justice. They remain particularly selective about contemporary content that aligns with their values, favoring works that provide wholesome entertainment for families.

- **Rating Behavior:** The user maintains a pattern of consistently high ratings (often 5.0), evidencing a critical yet appreciative viewing approach. Their latest review confirms their enjoyment of family-centered films, reinforcing their preference for content that fosters quality family time.

- **Content Engagement:** The user enjoys character-driven narratives, expressing dissatisfaction when themes undermine a film's potential. They prioritize high moral standards, especially in children’s entertainment, and actively seek out content that meets these criteria.

- **Collection Mindset:** The user exhibits a desire to build a substantial collection of classic and family-oriented films, indicating a collector mentality focused on beloved actors and enriching narratives.

- **Open-mindedness:** They are increasingly open to films that combine humor with traditional storytelling, valuing integrity and moral themes throughout their viewing experiences.

Overall, the user seeks films that blend classic storytelling with strong moral integrity, reflecting a dedication to family-friendly content that enriches their entertainment choices.
